title: Riot, Star Guardian Poppy should have some blue effects.
body:
https://pbs.twimg.com/media/Csvtx7xUkAA3cjJ.jpg

In her splash art we see her star buckler is blue. Yet in game when thrown it is yellow. 

https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=4A4P3O0uQuI

Sure there is a tiny blue comet trail, but I feel that it isn't matching with the splash art. 

As for her other abilities, people argue that because she's melee you can't change the looks of her abilities that much without confusion. Would changing her W to have more of a blueish tinge really effect the clarity that it's being activated?  Or making her E blue so it more accurately fits with her being the blue shooting star?  I can understand not changing the colors of the Q because that has a delay (though does Taric's stun color change with his skins?  I know Ekko's W does). 

Was Poppy's the last skin to be made?  Would that explain the lack of blue in her abilities?

replies.body: Hey! I think the reason we never really caught onto this is because Poppy in-game is 75% gold hammer, so the VFX never felt off. Looking at the splash and how blue it is we understand the disconnect and are looking into it. We have heard the feedback!
Thank you. I hope what happens from this works out for everyone.
Changes should now be on PBE, as always thank you for the feedback :)

This is soooooo much better!!!!!!!!  THANK YOU for listening and responding so promptly.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

The Star is not new. In fact, she had stars in every particle effect she has. Stars pop up when she smashes with Q, and in the very middle of the field. Stars are faintly visible in W and appear when an enemy jumps into it. Stars pop up when she slams someone against a wall with E. And then the pillars in R are stars. Always been there.
Well I guess the blue color made it more noticeable.

definitely! :)

At least one department listens to feedback...
Yep, the skins team is one of the best at Riot.  I think the only thing I've seen come out without sufficient edits were certain splash updates during the region unification.
To be fair though skins and art are a lot easier to give constructive criticism for than things like balance. You're comparing apples to oranges here and that's not fair to the balance team.
And yet even with apples and oranges, you can tell which batch is completely ripe and which one has a few rotten fruits thrown in.

Big difference is that Balancing the game is not about pleasing the community, but rather an objective "science" if you will that the boards by and large know jack shit about.

The art team has the SOLE purpose of pleasing the community within the bounds of their rules and themes.

Sure you might say this is apples to oranges, but a brown bananna, which you might see as rotten and useless,  makes some mean bananna bread and I think you forgot that, friend.
Man, anonymity makes people very cruel... Feelsbadman.

Oh so that makes the balance team exempt from criticism does it? Just because we can't compare them to the skins department?

Besides, ignoring the usual misinformed garbage, there have been many many cases of good balance feedback, and rework ideas posted on the boards...heck not even just balance stuff, pretty much everything you can think of.
So when you say, we're not being fair to the balance team, you mean you don't want us to criticise them? Sorry, but that is out of the question. 

I'd be saying the same thing about the skins team if it were the other way around I assure you.
Can you get us word from someone who can actually make this happen? No offense to the QA interns.
I'm actually a producer on the skins team, that title is out of date :P

Well then, my apologies. 

They should really update those.

But I agree with the OP that the skin should have a blue buckler effect...

Or at least change the splash so that it's gold and not misleading. Though I've always though there should be an image of the model+animations on a skin's splash for clarity.

Well, I see it's happening. 

I don't know how much influence you had on the decision, but you are now my favorite Rioter.

I can't see the VFX team going through the whole process thinking "her hair is blue, her colour theme is blue, her splash art is going to be overwhelmingly blue... better make all of her abilites gold."
Unless of course gold was just used because it was already there and their job half done, "just add a star to her classic "they thought

Lollipoppy, as much as everyone loves the meme, would have been better as a skin, then as joke, had they gone the extra mile to add something to it.

Honestly the argument that making the W be blue would cause clarity issues is false. 
Super Galaxy Shyvanna features a VERY dark blue on her W, and yet the particles show up perfectly fine on the skin.
There is nothing stopping them from making Poppy's abilities closer to blue. The E should 100% resemble a shooting star imo. 
Poppy actually has A LOT of particles to work with in regards to her skins, it is just that some are quite brief, but are still noticed. 
Poppy's skin feels VERY lackluster in regards to the others, especially considering all of the other skins (Minus Lux but hers doesn't count), have some sort of Companion that is 100% new animation and model.
Hers being made last, and as a result being made sub-par in regards to the other wouldn't surprise me in the least.

I agree, I feel like the 'hint' of blue is incredibly light. I'd like to see them turn it up a lot. The vibrant blue in her splash is really what makes me interested in getting it. I am okay with there being gold since she does have quite a bit of gold on her model, but I almost feel like simply because it is gold by default, it should have been changed to blue, just to make it feel even more special.
Even though I like Poppy's Star Guardian skin the most I totally agree. Adding more blue to her skill effects would make the skin absolutely perfect. Hopefully a Rioter sees this

I actually feel like they thought about it. If you think about it, her buckler is kind of like her familiar, and in that line of thought, they could have made it into a cute, cuddly, tiny creature. It would have been adorable. But get this: you have to _throw_ this cute creature at enemies. Sure, if you kill the unit it would come back to you as a sparkly shield, fine. _But if you don't_ it flops and bounces to the ground, hurt, helpless and you have to go pick it up and have it die in your arms essentially. #feelsbadman
Janna throws hers at people for her W and it doesn't really come back (until W comes off cd).

The difference there is that it doesn't feel bad though. Janna has always thrown a magical _something_ at the enemy. In her case since she's always done it and you don't see whatever said object is get hurt, you don't feel sad. It just disappears for a while and comes back. For Poppy, it would need to follow the same pattern her buckler does, which includes hitting the ground and _staying still_. I would be glad to be proven wrong, but my current opinion is that there isn't really a way to make doing that feel good.
It could fly through the air, hit the enemy, go "WEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!", and then land on the grand and do a little jig.
